title: ECOSoundSet: a finely annotated dataset for the automated acoustic identification of Orthoptera and Cicadidae in North, Central and temperate Western Europe
author: David Funosas (Station d'Écologie Théorique et Expérimentale), Elodie Massol (Université Paul Sabatier - Toulouse III), Yves Bas (Centre d'Ecologie et des Sciences de la Conservation), ..., Maxime Cauchoix (Université Paul Sabatier - Toulouse III)
relevance_why: The dataset and methodologies described could enhance Haohe's existing work on audio processing, especially in developing models that recognize complex sound patterns in ecological contexts.
background: The task involves identifying various species of insects based on their unique acoustic signatures captured in recordings, with a focus on Orthoptera and Cicadidae.
contribution: This paper introduces the ECOSoundSet dataset to solve the challenge of automating species identification in acoustic monitoring, achieving a comprehensive resource for deep learning model training.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous insect sound identification algorithms in Europe were limited in scope and mostly focused on a small number of species.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by providing a large, expertly annotated dataset covering a significant portion of insect sound diversity, which is essential for training more robust models.

key_innovation: The dataset features both weakly and strongly labeled recordings, facilitating more effective training of deep learning models for acoustic classification.
real_world_impact: This dataset can significantly advance automated insect monitoring, aiding biodiversity studies and conservation efforts by enabling effective tracking of insect populations over time.

new_terms.Passively Acoustic Monitoring (PAM): **Passive Acoustic Monitoring (PAM)** refers to the technique of recording sounds in an environment to study animal populations, particularly those that produce sounds, without human presence during the data collection.

open_sourcing: The dataset is available on Zenodo at https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15043893.
